member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Core.CommandListPosition

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.Core.ConnectionPool.IsEmpty
member.summary: Returns true if the connection pool is empty, i.e., all connections are in use. Note that in a highly-multithreaded environment, the value of this property may be stale by the time it's returned.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Core.ConnectionPool.GetProcedureCache
member.summary: Returns the stored procedure cache for this , lazily creating it on demand. This method may return a different object after has been called. The returned object is shared between multiple threads and is only safe to use after taking a lock on the object itself.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Core.ConnectionPool.RecoverLeakedSessionsAsync(MySqlConnector.Protocol.Serialization.IOBehavior)
member.summary: Examines all the objects in to determine if any have an owning that has been garbage-collected. If so, assumes that the connection was not properly disposed and returns the session to the pool.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.Core.ConnectionSettings.ConnectionStringBuilder
member.summary: The that was used to create this .!-- This object must not be mutated.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Core.ICancellableCommand
member.summary: provides an internal abstraction over operations that can be cancelled: and .

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Core.ICancellableCommandExtensions.GetNextId
member.summary: Returns a unique ID for all implementations of .

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Core.ICancellableCommandExtensions.GetCommandTimeUntilCanceled(MySqlConnector.Core.ICancellableCommand)
member.summary: Returns the time (in seconds) until a command should be canceled, clamping it to the maximum time allowed including CancellationTimeout.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Core.ICancellableCommandExtensions.ResetCommandTimeout(MySqlConnector.Core.ICancellableCommand)
member.summary: Causes the effective command timeout to be reset back to the value specified by plus . This allows for the command to time out, a cancellation to attempt to happen, then the "hard" timeout to occur.
member.remarks: As per the MSDN documentation, "This property is the cumulative time-out (for all network packets that are read during the invocation of a method) for all network reads during command execution or processing of the results. A time-out can still occur after the first row is returned, and does not include user processing time, only network read time. For example, with a 30 second time out, if Read requires two network packets, then it has 30 seconds to read both network packets. If you call Read again, it will have another 30 seconds to read any data that it requires." The method is called by public ADO.NET API methods to reset the effective time remaining at the beginning of a new method call.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Core.ICommandPayloadCreator

The to write the payload to.

member.summary: The indexes of the parameters in the prepared statement. There is one entry in this list for each parameter; it will be -1 if the parameter is named.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Logging.IMySqlConnectorLogger
member.summary: Implementations of write logs to a particular target.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Logging.IMySqlConnectorLogger.IsEnabled(MySqlConnector.Logging.MySqlConnectorLogLevel)
member.summary: Returns true if logging for this logger is enabled at the specified level.
member.returns: true if logging is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Logging.IMySqlConnectorLogger.Log(MySqlConnector.Logging.MySqlConnectorLogLevel,System.String,System.Object[],System.Exception)
member.summary: Writes a log message to the target.
member.param: The log message. See documentation for for notes on interpreting {0} within this string.

If not null or empty, then includes formatting placeholders (e.g., {0}) which must be replaced with the arguments in , using or similar. If null or an empty array, then is a literal string; any curly braces within it must be treated as literal characters, not formatting placeholders.
If not null, an associated with the log message.
member.remarks: This method may be called from multiple threads and must be thread-safe. This method may be called even if would return false for ; the implementation must check if logging is enabled for that level.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Logging.IMySqlConnectorLoggerProvider.CreateLogger(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a logger with the specified name. This method may be called from multiple threads and must be thread-safe.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.Logging.MySqlConnectorLogManager.Provider
member.summary: Allows the to be set for this library. can be set once, and must be set before any other library methods are used.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Logging.NoOpLogger
member.summary: is an implementation of that does nothing.
member.remarks: This is the default logging implementation unless is set.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.MySqlBatch

summary.para: implements the new ADO.NET batching API. It is currently experimental and may change in the future.

When using MariaDB (10.2 or later), the commands will be sent in a single batch, reducing network round-trip time. With other MySQL Servers, this may be no more efficient than executing the commands individually.

member.remarks: The proposed ADO.NET API that is based on is not finalized. This API is experimental and may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBatch.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new object. The property must be set before this object can be used.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBatch.#ctor(MySqlConnector.MySqlConnection,MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction)
member.summary: Initializes a new object, setting the and if specified.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBatch.BatchCommands
member.summary: The collection of commands that will be executed in the batch.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBatch.ExecuteReader
member.summary: Executes all the commands in the batch, returning a that can iterate over the result sets. If multiple resultsets are returned, use to access them.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBatch.ExecuteReaderAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Executes all the commands in the batch, returning a that can iterate over the result sets. If multiple resultsets are returned, use to access them.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A containing the result of the asynchronous operation.

summary.para: lets you efficiently load a MySQL Server table with data from another source. It is similar to the SqlBulkCopy class for SQL Server.
Due to security features in MySQL Server, the connection string must have AllowLoadLocalInfile=true in order to use this class.
For data that is in CSV or TSV format, use to bulk load the file.

remarks.para: Note: This API is a unique feature of MySqlConnector; you must switch to MySqlConnector in order to use it.
This API is experimental and may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.#ctor(MySqlConnector.MySqlConnection,MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction)
member.summary: Initializes a object with the specified connection, and optionally the active transaction.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.BulkCopyTimeout
member.summary: The number of seconds for the operation to complete before it times out, or 0 for no timeout.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.DestinationTableName
member.summary: The name of the table to insert rows into.
member.remarks: This name needs to be quoted if it contains special characters.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.NotifyAfter
member.summary: If non-zero, this specifies the number of rows to be processed before generating a notification event.

member.name: E:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.MySqlRowsCopied
member.summary: This event is raised every time that the number of rows specified by the property have been processed.

remarks.para: Receipt of a RowsCopied event does not imply that any rows have been sent to the server or committed.
The property can be set to true by the event handler to abort the copy.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.ColumnMappings
member.summary: A collection of objects. If the columns being copied from the data source line up one-to-one with the columns in the destination table then populating this collection is unnecessary. Otherwise, this should be filled with a collection of objects specifying how source columns are to be mapped onto destination columns. If one column mapping is specified, then all must be specified.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.RowsCopied
member.summary: Returns the number of rows that were copied (after WriteToServer(Async) finishes).

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.DataTable)
member.summary: Copies all rows in the supplied to the destination table specified by the property of the object.
member.remarks: This method is not available on netstandard1.3.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.DataTable,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously copies all rows in the supplied to the destination table specified by the property of the object.
member.remarks: This method is not available on netstandard1.3.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Data.DataRow},System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all rows in the supplied sequence of objects to the destination table specified by the property of the object. The number of columns to be read from the objects must be specified in advance.
member.param: The number of columns to copy (in each row).
member.remarks: This method is not available on netstandard1.3.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Data.DataRow},System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously copies all rows in the supplied sequence of objects to the destination table specified by the property of the object. The number of columns to be read from the objects must be specified in advance.
member.param: The number of columns to copy (in each row).
A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: This method is not available on netstandard1.3.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.WriteToServer(System.Data.IDataReader)
member.summary: Copies all rows in the supplied to the destination table specified by the property of the object.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopy.WriteToServerAsync(System.Data.IDataReader,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously copies all rows in the supplied to the destination table specified by the property of the object.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.

summary.para: Use to specify how to map columns in the source data to columns in the destination table when using .

Set to the index of the source column to map. Set to either the name of a column in the destination table, or the name of a user-defined variable. If a user-defined variable, you can use to specify a MySQL expression that assigns its value to destination column.
Source columns that don't have an entry in will be ignored (unless the collection is empty, in which case all columns will be mapped one-to-one).

MySqlConnector will transmit all binary data as hex, so any expression that operates on it must decode it with the UNHEX function first. (This will be performed automatically if no is specified, but will be necessary to specify manually for more complex expressions.)

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopyColumnMapping.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.param: The ordinal position of the source column.
The name of the destination column.
The optional expression to be used to set the destination column.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopyColumnMapping.SourceOrdinal
member.summary: The ordinal position of the source column to map from.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopyColumnMapping.DestinationColumn
member.summary: The name of the destination column to copy to. To use an expression, this should be the name of a unique user-defined variable.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkCopyColumnMapping.Expression
member.summary: An optional expression for setting a destination column. To use an expression, the should be set to the name of a user-defined variable and this expression should set a column using that variable.
member.remarks: To populate a binary column, you must set to a variable name, and to an expression that uses UNHEX to set the column value, e.g., `destColumn` = UNHEX(@variableName).

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader

summary.para: lets you efficiently load a MySQL Server Table with data from a CSV or TSV file or .

member.remarks: Due to security features in MySQL Server, the connection string must have AllowLoadLocalInfile=true in order to use a local source.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.CharacterSet
member.summary: (Optional) The character set of the source data. By default, the database's character set is used.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.Columns
member.summary: (Optional) A list of the column names in the destination table that should be filled with data from the input file.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.ConflictOption
member.summary: A value that specifies how conflicts are resolved (default ).

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.EscapeCharacter
member.summary: (Optional) The character used to escape instances of within field values.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.Expressions
member.summary: (Optional) A list of expressions used to set field values from the columns in the source data.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.FieldQuotationCharacter
member.summary: (Optional) The character used to enclose fields in the source data.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.FieldQuotationOptional
member.summary: Whether quoting fields is optional (default false).

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.FieldTerminator
member.summary: (Optional) The string fields are terminated with.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.FileName
member.summary: The name of the local (if is true) or remote (otherwise) file to load. Either this or must be set.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.LinePrefix
member.summary: (Optional) A prefix in each line that should be skipped when loading.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.LineTerminator
member.summary: (Optional) The string lines are terminated with.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.Local
member.summary: Whether a local file is being used (default true).

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.NumberOfLinesToSkip
member.summary: The number of lines to skip at the beginning of the file (default 0).

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.Priority
member.summary: A giving the priority to load with (default ).

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.SourceStream
member.summary: A containing the data to load. Either this or must be set. The property must be true if this is set.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.TableName
member.summary: The name of the table to load into. If this is a reserved word or contains spaces, it must be quoted.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.#ctor(MySqlConnector.MySqlConnection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified .

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.Load
member.summary: Loads all data in the source file or stream into the destination table.
member.returns: The number of rows inserted.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlBulkLoader.LoadAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously loads all data in the source file or stream into the destination table.
member.returns: A that will be completed with the number of rows inserted.

member.summary: Asynchronously loads all data in the source file or stream into the destination table.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A that will be completed with the number of rows inserted.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlConnection.ResetConnectionAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resets the session state of the current open connection; this clears temporary tables and user-defined variables.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A ValueTask representing the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: This is an optional feature of the MySQL protocol and may not be supported by all servers. It's known to be supported by MySQL Server 5.7.3 (and later) and MariaDB 10.2.4 (and later). Other MySQL-compatible servers or proxies may not support this command.

member.summary: Returns an unopened copy of this connection with a new connection string. If the Password in is not set, the password from this connection will be used. This allows creating a new connection with the same security information while changing other options, such as database or pooling.

member.returns: A new with different connection string options but the same password as this connection (unless overridden by ).

member.summary: You have an error in your SQL syntax (ER_PARSE_ERROR).

member.summary: is thrown when MySQL Server returns an error code, or there is a communication error with the server.

member.summary: A value identifying the kind of error. Prefer to use the property.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlException.ErrorCode
member.summary: A value identifying the kind of error.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlException.SqlState
member.summary: A SQLSTATE code identifying the kind of error.
member.remarks: See SQLSTATE for more information.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlException.IsTransient
member.summary: Returns true if this exception could indicate a transient error condition (that could succeed if retried); otherwise, false.

member.summary: Sets the with information about the exception.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat
member.summary: Determines which column type (if any) should be read as a System.Guid.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.Default
member.summary: Same as Char36 if OldGuids=False; same as LittleEndianBinary16 if OldGuids=True.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.None
member.summary: No column types are read/written as a Guid.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.Char36
member.summary: All CHAR(36) columns are read/written as a Guid using lowercase hex with hyphens, which matches UUID().

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.Char32
member.summary: All CHAR(32) columns are read/written as a Guid using lowercase hex without hyphens.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.Binary16
member.summary: All BINARY(16) columns are read/written as a Guid using big-endian byte order, which matches UUID_TO_BIN(x).

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.TimeSwapBinary16
member.summary: All BINARY(16) columns are read/written as a Guid using big-endian byte order with time parts swapped, which matches UUID_TO_BIN(x,1).

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlGuidFormat.LittleEndianBinary16
member.summary: All BINARY(16) columns are read/written as a Guid using little-endian byte order, i.e. the byte order used by and .

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlHelper.EscapeString(System.String)
member.summary: Escapes single and double quotes, and backslashes in .

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlLoadBalance.RoundRobin
member.summary: Each new connection opened for a connection pool uses the next host name (sequentially with wraparound).

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlLoadBalance.FailOver
member.summary: Each new connection tries to connect to the first host; subsequent hosts are used only if connecting to the first one fails.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlLoadBalance.Random
member.summary: Servers are tried in random order.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlLoadBalance.LeastConnections
member.summary: Servers are tried in ascending order of number of currently-open connections.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.MySqlProtocolException
member.summary: is thrown when there is an internal protocol error communicating with MySQL Server.

member.summary: Creates a new for an out-of-order packet.
member.returns: A new .

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlRowsCopiedEventArgs.Abort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the bulk copy operation should be aborted.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlRowsCopiedEventArgs.RowsCopied
member.summary: Gets a value that returns the number of rows copied during the current bulk copy operation.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.MySqlRowsCopiedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that handles the event of a .

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlServerRedirectionMode.Disabled
member.summary: Server redirection will not be performed.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlServerRedirectionMode.Preferred
member.summary: Server redirection will occur if possible, otherwise the original connection will be used.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlServerRedirectionMode.Required
member.summary: Server redirection must occur, otherwise connecting fails.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlSslMode.Preferred
member.summary: Use SSL if the server supports it.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlSslMode.Required
member.summary: Always use SSL. Deny connection if server does not support SSL.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlSslMode.VerifyCA
member.summary: Always use SSL. Validate the Certificate Authority but tolerate name mismatch.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.MySqlSslMode.VerifyFull
member.summary: Always use SSL. Fail if the host name is not correct.

member.summary: Asynchronously rolls back the database transaction.

member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.Release(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the named transaction savepoint with the specified . No commit or rollback occurs.
member.remarks: The proposed ADO.NET API that this is based on is not finalized; this API may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.ReleaseAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously removes the named transaction savepoint with the specified . No commit or rollback occurs.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: The proposed ADO.NET API that this is based on is not finalized; this API may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.Rollback(System.String)
member.summary: Rolls back the current transaction to the savepoint with the specified without aborting the transaction.

remarks.para: The name must have been created with , but not released by calling .
The proposed ADO.NET API that this is based on is not finalized; this API may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.RollbackAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously rolls back the current transaction to the savepoint with the specified without aborting the transaction.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

remarks.para: The name must have been created with , but not released by calling .
The proposed ADO.NET API that this is based on is not finalized; this API may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.Save(System.String)
member.summary: Sets a named transaction savepoint with the specified . If the current transaction already has a savepoint with the same name, the old savepoint is deleted and a new one is set.
member.remarks: The proposed ADO.NET API that this is based on is not finalized; this API may change in the future.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.SaveAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously sets a named transaction savepoint with the specified . If the current transaction already has a savepoint with the same name, the old savepoint is deleted and a new one is set.
member.param: A token to cancel the asynchronous operation.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: The proposed ADO.NET API that this is based on is not finalized; this API may change in the future.

member.summary: Gets the that this transaction is associated with.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.DbConnection
member.summary: Gets the that this transaction is associated with.

member.name: P:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets the of this transaction. This value is set from or any other overload that specifies an .

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases any resources associated with this transaction. If it was not committed, it will be rolled back.
member.param: true if this method is being called from Dispose; false if being called from a finalizer.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.MySqlTransaction.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously releases any resources associated with this transaction. If it was not committed, it will be rolled back.
member.returns: A representing the asynchronous operation.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Protocol.CharacterSet
member.remarks: Obtained from SELECT id, collation_name FROM information_schema.collations ORDER BY id; on MySQL 8.0.16.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ColumnFlags.PrimaryKey
member.summary: Field is part of a primary key.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ColumnFlags.UniqueKey
member.summary: Field is part of a unique key.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ColumnFlags.MultipleKey
member.summary: Field is part of a nonunique key.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ColumnFlags.Blob
member.summary: Field is a BLOB or TEXT (deprecated).

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Protocol.Payloads.EofPayload.IsEof(MySqlConnector.Protocol.PayloadData)
member.summary: Returns true if contains an EOF packet. Note that EOF packets can appear in places where a length-encoded integer (which starts with the same signature byte) may appear, so the length has to be checked to verify that it is an EOF packet.
member.returns: true if this is an EOF packet; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.LongPassword
member.summary: Use the improved version of Old Password Authentication.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.FoundRows
member.summary: Send found rows instead of affected rows in EOF_Packet.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.ConnectWithDatabase
member.summary: Database (schema) name can be specified on connect in Handshake Response Packet.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.LocalFiles
member.summary: Enables the LOCAL INFILE request of LOAD DATA|XML.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.Interactive
member.summary: Server: Supports interactive and noninteractive clients. Client: The session wait_timeout variable is set to the value of the session interactive_timeout variable.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.Transactions
member.summary: Can send status flags in EOF_Packet.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.MultiStatements
member.summary: Can handle multiple statements per COM_QUERY and COM_STMT_PREPARE.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.MultiResults
member.summary: Can send multiple resultsets for COM_QUERY.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.PreparedStatementMultiResults
member.summary: Can send multiple resultsets for COM_STMT_EXECUTE.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.PluginAuth
member.summary: Sends extra data in Initial Handshake Packet and supports the pluggable authentication protocol.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.PluginAuthLengthEncodedClientData
member.summary: Understands length-encoded integer for auth response data in Protocol::HandshakeResponse41.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.CanHandleExpiredPasswords
member.summary: Announces support for expired password extension.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.SessionTrack
member.summary: Can set SERVER_SESSION_STATE_CHANGED in the Status Flags and send session-state change data after a OK packet.

member.name: F:MySqlConnector.Protocol.ProtocolCapabilities.DeprecateEof
member.summary: Can send OK after a Text Resultset.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Protocol.Serialization.ArraySegmentHolder`1
member.summary: is a class that holds an instance of . Its primary difference from is that it's a reference type, so mutations to this object are visible to other objects that hold a reference to it.

member.name: M:MySqlConnector.Protocol.Serialization.AuthenticationUtility.HashPassword(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.String)
member.summary: Hashes a password with the "Secure Password Authentication" method.
member.param: The 20-byte random challenge (from the "auth-plugin-data" in the initial handshake).
member.returns: A 20-byte password hash.
member.remarks: See Secure Password Authentication.

member.name: T:MySqlConnector.Protocol.Serialization.NegotiateToMySqlConverterStream
member.summary:
Helper class to translate NegotiateStream framing for SPNEGO token into MySQL protocol packets.
Serves as underlying stream for System.Net.NegotiateStream to perform MariaDB's auth_gssapi_client authentication.
NegotiateStream protocol is described in e.g here https://winprotocoldoc.blob.core.windows.net/productionwindowsarchives/MS-NNS/[MS-NNS].pdf We only use Handshake Messages for authentication.
